title: China Makes Veiled Jab at US Before Hosting Modi, Putin, Erdogan
description: China used an event marking the final stretch before its biggest diplomatic event of the year to accuse the US of “threatening world peace,” in a thinly veiled critique of the rival superpower just before it hosts a key gathering of global leaders.
content:
China used an event marking the final stretch before its biggest diplomatic event of the year to accuse the US of “threatening world peace,” in a thinly veiled critique of the rival superpower just before it hosts a key gathering of global leaders.

More than 20 foreign leaders are set to attend the annual summit of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation, a bloc of countries led by Russia and China, Assistant Foreign Minister Liu Bin told reporters Friday during a briefing in Beijing. Russia’s Vladimir Putin , Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan are among those expected at the meeting in the northeastern port city of Tianjin Aug. 31-Sept. 1.
summary: China has accused the US of threatening world peace before hosting its biggest diplomatic event of the year, the annual summit of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation, led by Russia and China. The event, which will take place in the northeastern port city of Tianjin, will be attended by over 20 foreign leaders including Vladimir Putin, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
shortSummary: China's government is hosting a major international gathering, including leaders like Vladimir Putin and Shinzo Abe, amid criticism of the US for threatening world peace.

argos_summary: China has accused the US of threatening world peace ahead of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit, which will host over 20 foreign leaders, including Vladimir Putin and Narendra Modi, in Tianjin from August 31 to September 1. The event marks a significant diplomatic gathering for China as it prepares to assume the rotating presidency of the SCO, emphasizing cooperation among member states on various issues, including security and economic integration.
